item.title: Karnataka Election Projections
item.description: The Karnataka elections are just around the corner and election analysis is the most interesting of the bunch to do in the field of analytics. The entire last week, I tried answering one question - Can we project the constituency affiliations of major contesting parties of Karnataka. And trying to answer the question led me to the following: Karnataka has 224 constituencies of which 169 exist from 1978 and 55 from 2008 Congress won 5 out of the past 9 elections stating that it has a strong presence Of the 224 constituencies, 91 constituencies have a medium to high probability of Congress winning them.

item.title: Cryptocurrency analysis - What to trade?
item.description: I recently developed a rudimentary method to identify the potential cryptocurrencies to BUY and trade. I did this exercise for Gramenerâ€™s blog. Reposting the same below. The actual article that I wrote can be found here I followed the below steps: Scraped the entire trading history of each of the cryptocurrencies available at CoinMarketCap Filtered cryptocurrencies based on Market capital, moving averages and Prices Ran a greedy search to identify the combination of moving averages that yielded maximum profits on cross over points trading strategy.
